In 1992, BMW M launched the next generation of its BMW M3 high-performance sports coupe.It was notable for its modern design, significantly higher power and increased comfort. On closer inspection,however, sports car fans quickly realised that the M3 E36 carried the same M specific motorsport DNA as its predecessor.Letâ€™s take a closer look at the first BMW M3 to feature a six-cylinder engine.
